intro: Dispermotheca alpestris, commonly known as the alpine dispersotheca, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, also known as the mustard family, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool temperatures. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Dispermotheca alpestris is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
